summary: The concept of "European conference" pertains to a formal gathering within the framework of international affairs, specifically under the auspices of the European Union. Such conferences serve as platforms for dialogue, negotiation, and collaboration among member states and other stakeholders on various legal and regulatory issues. They facilitate the exchange of best practices, foster mutual understanding, and aim to harmonize policies across the EU. These conferences are crucial for shaping EU legislation and ensuring compliance with international obligations, thereby enhancing the coherence of EU governance in the global arena.
